runs.inputTranscription: Gi t Hub ア クション ズ の ワーク フ ルー を 最適 化 し まし た 。 並 列 実 行 に し て 所 要 時間 を 1 5 分 から 5 分 に 短縮 キャ ッシュ で ノー ド アン ダー スコ ー モ ジュールズ を キャッシュ ファ クト で ビル ド 成果 物 を 保存 し ます 。 ラン ナー は ウ ブ ンツ レイ テ スト で 統一 し まし た 。

runs.outputTranscription: We optimized the GitHub Actions workflow. We executed in parallel, reducing the required time from 15 to 5 minutes, cached node_modules with cache, and saved build artifacts with artifact. Runners are unified with ubuntu-latest.

runs.reference: We will perform parallel testing of multiple environments using Matrix Strategy. We will simultaneously execute 9 patterns of Node.js 18/20/22 and OS ubuntu/windows/macos, and only failed Jobs can be re-executed. We have set Timeout to 30 minutes.

runs.reference: We have implemented conditional branching for Workflow Trigger. Push is only for feature/*, PR is only for main/develop, and a full test will be executed every night at midnight with Schedule. Execution control is also performed according to changed files with Path Filter.
runs.output: We have made the workflow trigger conditional. We will execute full tests every night at midnight on a schedule where push is only for feature branches and PRs are only for main/develop. We are also controlling execution according to changed files with path filters.

runs.output: In a reusable workflow, we modularized processing. We separated test, build, and deploy, and call them with workflow calls. Maintainability significantly improved.

runs.reference: We will implement read/write separation using CQRS. runs.reference: We will make this project a quasi-mandate contract. Deliverable responsibility is not required, and the target is task execution; we will exercise the duty of due care as experts. There is a monthly reporting obligation, and command and control authority resides with our company. Unlike contracting, there is no nonconformity liability.
runs.output: We will make this project a mandate contract. The target is task execution, not deliverables responsibility. We will pay attention as experts with duty of care. There is a monthly reporting obligation, and our company has the right to command. It is different from contracting, and there is no liability for nonconformity to the contract.
runs.inputTranscription: この 案 件 は 順 位 認 契約 に し ましょう 。 成 果 物 責 任 は なく 業 務 遂行 が 対象 。 注 意 義 務 で 専 門 家 と し て 注意 を 払い 。 月 時 で 報告 義務 が あり 、 命 令 権 は 当社 が です 。 受 け お と 違い 、 契 約 不 適 合 責任 は あり ませ ん 。
runs.inputTranscriptionNormalized: この案件は順位認契約にしましょう 。 成果物責任はなく業務遂行が対象 。 注意義務で専門家として注意を払い 。 月時で報告義務があり 、 命令権は当社がです 。 受けおと違い 、 契約不適合責任はありません 。

runs.reference: Currently, there is a risk of disguised subcontracting. Despite the contract being a subcontract, the ordering party is directly instructing. We will either switch to a quasi-mandate contract or clarify the command and control structure. If the Labor Bureau conducts an audit, there is a high possibility of receiving a corrective order.
runs.output: Currently, there is a risk of disguised contracting. It is a state where the ordering party is directly instructing despite it being a subcontracting agreement. We should either switch to a subcontractor or clarify the formal command structure. There is a high possibility that a labor bureau audit will result in a corrective order.
runs.inputTranscription: 現 状 は 偽 装 受 け の リスク が あり ます 。 受 け お 契 約 な の に 発 注 側 が 直 接 指 示 し て いる 状態 です 。 順 位 人 に 切り 替え る か 式 命 令 系 統 を 明 確 化 す べき です 。 労 働 局 の 監 査 が 入る と 是 正 勧 告 さ れ る 可能 性 が 高い です 。
runs.inputTranscriptionNormalized: 現状は偽装受けのリスクがあります 。 受けお契約なのに発注側が直接指示している状態です 。 順位人に切り替えるか式命令系統を明確化すべきです 。 労働局の監査が入ると是正勧告される可能性が高いです 。
runs.outputTranscription: Currently, there is a risk of disguised contracts. Despite being a contract, it is a situation where the ordering party is switching to quasi-delegation direct instructions.

runs.reference: This project is a fourth-tier subcontract. The unit price has been reduced by 60% due to intermediate margins from the prime contractor through the first, second, and third tiers. Although the end-user is paying 1.5 million yen per month, the actual engineer only receives 600,000 yen. We should shorten the supply chain (商流).
runs.output: This project was received at 4 o'clock. From 1 o'clock, 2 o'clock, and 3 o'clock, the unit price is reduced by 60% with intermediate margins. The end user is paying 1.5 million per month, but the actual engineer only receives 600,000. The "Shoryu" (rising dragon) process should be shortened.
runs.inputTranscription: この 案 件 は 4 時 受け です 。 から 1 時 、 2 時 、 3 時 と 中 間 マー ジン で 単 価 が 6 0 % 削 ら れ て い ます 。 エン ド ユー ザー は 月 1 5 0 万 払 っ て いる の に 実 際 の エン ジ ニア に は 6 0 万 しか 渡り ませ ん 。 昇 龍 を 短縮 す べき です 。
runs.inputTranscriptionNormalized: この案件は 4 時受けです 。 から 1 時 、 2 時 、 3 時と中間マー ジンで単価が 60 % 削られています 。 エンドユー ザー は月 150 万払っているのに実際のエンジニアには 60 万しか渡りません 。 昇龍を短縮すべきです 。

runs.reference: We will secure a dedicated team under a lab contract. The team will consist of 6 members under a 6-month contract, with fixed monthly costs of 3 million yen to fix variable costs, and we can flexibly respond to scope changes. This contract form is more stable than SES and more flexible than contracting (ukeoi).
runs.output: We will secure all continuous teams with lab contracts. A team of 6 people can fix variable costs with a 6-month contract at 3 million yen per month, and flexibly respond to scope changes. It is more stable than SES. It is a more flexible contract type.

runs.outputTranscription: In a lab contract, we will secure a 600-person team structure. With a 6-month contract at 3 million yen per month,

Communication costs have been significantly reduced, and rework has decreased to 1/3.
runs.output: We have placed a bridge SE in offshore development. They are bilingual in Japanese and Vietnamese. We will accurately translate technical usage. We will also adjust for cultural differences. Communication costs have been significantly reduced, and rework has been reduced to 1/3.

runs.reference: Since full offshore carries high risk, we will first test nearshore in Hokkaido. There is no time zone difference, no language barrier, face-to-face meetings are possible, and the man-month cost is 70% of Tokyo. If successful, we will expand to overseas offshore.
runs.output: Full offshore is high risk, so we will first try nearshore in Hokkaido with no language barrier. Face-to-face meetings are also possible. The monthly unit price is 70% of Tokyo's.
runs.inputTranscription: フ ル オ フ ショ ア は リ スク が 高い の で 、 まず 北 海 道 の ニ ア ショ ア で 試し ます 。 ゾー ン な し 言 語 障 壁 な し 、 対 面 ミー ティング も 可 能 。 人 月 単 価 は 東 京 の 7 0 % です 。 成 功 し たら 海 外 オ フ ショ ア に 拡大 し ます 。
runs.inputTranscriptionNormalized: フルオフショアはリスクが高いので 、 まず北海道のニアショアで試します 。 ゾー ンなし言語障壁なし 、 対面ミー ティングも可能 。 人月単価は東京の 70 % です 。 成功したら海外オフショアに拡大します 。
runs.outputTranscription: Full offshore is high risk, so we will first try nearshore in Hokkaido with no language barrier. Face-to-face meetings are also possible. The monthly unit price is 70% of Tokyo's.

runs.reference: We want to revise the man-month unit price. Currently it is 1.5 million yen, but it is too high considering the skill set and market price. We will negotiate with other companies for competitive quotes at 1.2 million yen, and based on actual results, we will negotiate a phased reduction from 1.3 million yen → 1.2 million yen.
runs.output: We want to review the personnel cost unit price. Currently it is 1.5 million yen, but it is too high considering the skill set and market price. We will negotiate with other companies for an estimated 1.2 million yen, and a phased reduction from 1.3 million yen to 1.2 million yen based on actual results.
runs.inputTranscription: 人 事 原 価 単価 を 見直し たい です 。 現 在 1 5 0 万 円 です が 、 ス キル セ ット と 市 場 相 場 を 考 慮 する と 高 すぎ ます 。 あ み 積 もり で 他 者 は 1 2 0 万 円 、 実 績 ベー ス で 段 階 的 に 1 3 0 万 円 から 1 2 0 万 円 に 引き 下げ 交渉 し ます 。
runs.inputTranscriptionNormalized: 人事原価単価を見直したいです 。 現在 150 万円ですが 、 スキルセットと市場相場を考慮すると高すぎます 。 あみ積もりで他者は 120 万円 、 実績ベー スで段階的に 130 万円から 120 万円に引き下げ交渉します 。
runs.outputTranscription: I want to review the personnel unit price. It is 150 million yen, but considering the skill set and market rates, it is too high.

runs.reference: We have created an RFP. It specifies system requirements, non-functional requirements, organization, schedule, and budget ceiling. The evaluation criteria are technical capabilities at 40%, price at 30%, and past performance at 30%. We will present it to five companies, hold presentations in two weeks, and select a vendor in one month.

System requirements, functional requirements, schedule, and budget upper limit are clearly stated, and the evaluation criteria are technical capabilities 40%, price 30%, and past performance 30%. We will present it to 5 companies, and present [something] 2 weeks later, and select [a company] 1 month later.

runs.reference: We will clarify the acceptance criteria because they are ambiguous. We will set the objective criteria as: 100% implementation of functional requirements, clearance of performance requirements, a bug density of 0.5 bugs/KLOC or less, and passing the User Acceptance Test (UAT). The acceptance period is two weeks, and automatic approval will occur if there are no comments within the period.
runs.output: Since training standards are ambiguous, we will clarify them.
